IRS990.MissionDescription: Unity College is a small, private college in rural Maine that provides dedicated, engaged students with a liberal arts education that emphasizes the environment and natural resources. Graduates of the college are prepared to be environmental stewards, effective leaders, and responsible citizens through active learning experiences within a supportive community.
IRS990.Description: Unity College is a small, independent, not-for-profit, co-educational college located in central Maine. While remaining a liberal arts college, Unity has evolved to become the only college in the country to specialize in baccalaureate programs having a natural resource management focus. The College offers baccalaureate programs with emphasis in the environmental sciences, natural resource management, and wilderness based outdoor recreation. The College also offers associate degree programs. Unity College serves 564 students on its 185-acre rural, residential campus.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Refundable advances - federal revolving loan program

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The intended uses of the endowment funds include funding for scholarships, the Field of Dreams and the Unity Centre for the Performing Arts, Kendeda Eco Village, capital and technological acquisitions, and other activities of the College.
Change in value of gift of future interest 11,231.
Institutional Aid 4,021,405. Pell Grants 1,172,143. State Scholarships 191,113. SMART 182,000. ACG 79,125.
Institutional Aid 4,021,405. PELL Grants 1,172,143. State Scholarships 191,113. SMART 182,000. ACG 79,125.

Form990ScheduleEPartII.Explanation: Policy is stated in all recruiting materials.
Unity College participates in various governmental financial aid and grant programs for student financial aid and work study wages.

Form990ScheduleIPartIII.TypeOfGrant: Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grant Program
National Science and Mathematics Access to Retain Talent Grant

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the students account directly. This system ensures that the funds are used appropriately.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Employee of the College and president's spouse
Form990ScheduleLPartIV.DescriptionOfTransaction: Payment at fair market value for services rendered to the College.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: At times, the College utilizes the services of a stock brokerage firm to sell donations of stock.

Periodically, the College receives donations of noncash items that are used for internal purposes and have no readily available FMV. In the current year, such items were received and have been included on this schedule.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of the 990 was provided to each member of the board of trustees before filing. The 990 was reviewed by the vice president of finance and administration and the treasurer of the board of trustees.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Trustees and institutional officers must sign a conflict of interest statement. Trustees or officers who have declared or been found to have a conflict of interest shall refrain from participating in the consideration of proposed transactions, unless for special reasons the board or administration requests information or interpretation. Persons with conflicts shall not vote or be present at the time of the vote.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The president's compensation was determined using a compensation survey or study, approved by the board, and a written employment contract is in place.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The organization does not make its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Changes in Net Assets or Fund Balances:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Net unrealized gains on investments: 374,809. Change in value of gift of future interest 11,231. Total to Form 990, Part XI, Line 5: 386,040.
The audit committee process has not changed from the prior year.
